title: Granddaughters love them!
text: I purchased several of these for my granddaughters for Xmas & they absolutely love them. In fact so do their brothers. Lol. Be aware that there are tiny magnets in them so that you can perch the ppl onto the animals & keep them there. I almost didn't buy them bc of that given all the news stories about kids and magnets, but the magnets are INSIDE the toys. So as long as ur kids aren't eating their toys you should be okay, but be careful around your pets so that the pets don't try to eat them.  My grandkids adore all things Schleich as do I bc I bought it for their parents too decades ago.  Schleich is well made & lasts forever.

title: Cute for young kids, not the highest quality
text: This is a really cute way to give children a headstart on learning to save. My 5 year old grandson just loves this and is always looking for spare change to add to the safe. I am deducting a star simply because I am not sure how long this may last. The door was not easy to unlock and, once it was, I was afraid that it would come of the hinges unless I took a lot of care to open and close it. I know that if my grandson was doing it, this would have been in the stash already. I think you should look for a sturdier device.

title: One of the best on the market today!
text: This is a fantastic pool/water float. We recently went on vacation to a lake in Northern California and this was a great thing to have. We actually used it as a tow behind a boat creating hours of fun for the young (and old) on the trip as well as just using it in the lake to relax on. We also brought it back to my son's house for use in his pool. It is large, well made, comfortable and the cup holders are great (used both cans and Solo cups). Highly recommend for all your outdoor activities.

title: Really nice pool float!
text: This is a super cute quality made chair float. I will say I am glad I had one of the automated things to blow it up because it was much larger than I thought it would be (never could have blown it up the old fashioned way). Super colorful and, like I said, large. I fit in there easy with room to spare. I love the cup holder and it's really comfy, too! Highly recommend!

title: Fun stickers, entertained my grandson!
text: These are super cute. I thought these would be good for when my 4 year old grandson came over and boy was I right! He loved putting together the stickers and making sea scenes. He particularly liked the shark (of course). Hours of fun for him. It's just what I needed to entertain him during this pandemic and considering the price was less than $10, it was highly worth. Great fun for young kids!

title: Hours of fun for the little ones!
text: My seven year old grandson absolutely loved this remote control car! First, it is well made and sizeable for his little hands to hold. Second, it is super easy for him to operate. Within minutes of my installing batteries, he was off using it. After several 'crashes', I was amazed at how well this car stood up to a child's mild abuse. He loves all the tricks and fancy maneuvers he can make with the car and plays with it for hours when he is here. It also comes in a great box for gift giving (would make a great holiday present). Highly recommend for the child in your life.

title: Cute functional piggy bank!
text: Super cute piggy bank. I gave this to my 4 year old grandson to get him into saving money. I wish it would work with bills, too, but I understand it is for coins. The LED display is large, bright and clear and easy to read. My grandson loves putting coins in and seeing the number change. As he gets a little older, this will make a great teaching tool for him to learn some basic math, too. This would make a great Christmas present for the child in your life!

title: A great way to teach children the value of money!
text: This piggy bank is super cute. Wasn't quite sure what to expect with this. But, once I received and set it up for my 6 year old grandson, he was hooked. He loved putting in pennies one by one while he counted along with the LED display. Of course, be aware that your kids will be bugging you for change at every opportunity, lol. I think this is a great way to teach your children the value of saving money and also just how mathematics work. This makes a great gift for a child.

title: Really nice floor puzzle! My grandbabies loved this!!
text: I have two grand children, ages 6 and 3. I gave this to them on a visit here last weekend and they loved this Melissa and Doug puzzle. This puzzle is colorful and the pieces are large enough for even the three year old to handle and succeed at helping complete the puzzle but also challenging enough for the six year old. And it has dinosaurs (which both of my grandbabies are really into at this point in their lives. Great way to entertain the young ones while they learn to make the shape and sizes fit. Highly recommend!

title: Great fun for kids!
text: I got these for when I am substitute teaching as a time filler. The girls absolutely loved these. Easy to use, colorful, hundreds of combinations, these will keep your kids busy for hours. These 'pop' together easily and even the kindergartners I used these with made some really cute bracelets. I have recently purchased another package as I have given away most of the first package of snap beads. Highly recommend these as a great rainy day activity or any time you want kids (girls or boys) to have fun!

title: Hours of fun for all!
text: This is the second pack I have had of these (the first I bought last June). My grandchildren loved these when they came to visit me in Central Florida in July). First, they feel like snowballs (minus the temperature. Second, they are totally harmless when it comes to things they come in contact with (no damage to lamps, tables etc). Third, they look like real snowballs. I had to get another pack for them to have at their home since they had so much fun with these. These would be great in your home for fun and play where no one gets hurt and everyone has a great time. Highly recommend!

title: Really nice remote control car perfect for the child in your life
text: I had received this remote car about a month or so ago and couldn't use it until this weekend when my grandsons visited. I can honestly say, my six year old grandbaby loved this car and played with it for hours. Well made, colorful, realistic, easy to set up and use, this car was great even for a child this young (of course, under adult supervision). It maneuvered well and caused no damage to walls or furniture. This is RC Cars product is a great, reasonably priced, remote control car which will definitely make the youngster in your life happy. This care would make a great holiday present under the tree as well.

title: Great primary puzzle toy to hel baby grow and learn!
text: My 14 month old grand baby loves this. Having recently taken him to the beach here in Florida (Juno) and also the acquarium, he loves all things ocean and fish. Thus sorter toy is terrific. Colorful, soft pieces with challenging sized pieces which allow him to try to work on getting the pieces to fit in the most fun way possible. And it hasn't seemed to get old at all as I have brought this out to him at least 5 times now and he loves playing with it. This is a must have to help baby develop cognitive and ambulatory skills,

title: Great learning item with our solar system and basic savings!
text: Super cute! My grandson (3.5 years old) absolutely loved this. His dad is a pilot in the Air Force and he has seen loads of pictures of the planets and the moon, but now has one he can actually look at and hold in his hands. An added bonus is the ability to learn the value of starting to save, which I absolutely love. Only complaint (as others have mentioned) may be that the glow in the dark feature doesn't last as long as I would like. But, then again, it's not that bad that it interferes with the design. Anyway, no complaints, nothing but kudos for my son grandson loving this!

title: Another wonderful product from Fisher-Price!!
text: I had this set up and ready to go, when my soon to be two year grandson came to visit. OMG, he squealed with delight the second he saw it. His father has an ATV that he regularly takes my grand baby out on. Of course, this set 'he' was able to be the driver. Such a hit, never knew this was going to be as big a deal as it ended up being. We couldn't even get him off of this for dinner. I knew with the Fisher-Price name,  this would a safe and ride for him! Thank goodness he fell asleep prior to the time he had to leave, so his parents were able to pry him from this, lol. My daughter in law called me yesterday to tell me that all her son keeps saying is 'Memaw bike?' Needless to say, they will back next weekend. I am so happy I got this set. This will make a wonderful Christmas/holiday gift for the toddler in your life.

title: Another quality fun product from Fisher-Price!
text: My grandson absolutely flipped out over this set. He loves the colors and the music and the elephant (he even takes it into bed with him, lol). I love Fisher-Price, and I buy their products almost exclusively for my grandkids. Educational, safe, and so much fun. I love the fact that the legs on the elephant move so my three year old grandbaby can move it across the floor like it was alive! No complaints at all about this product and I, too, have purchased other items in the Little People series and this one set is just as good, if not better, than others I have bought. This would make a wonderful Christmas or Holiday present for the little one in your life.

title: Lots of laughs, great fun for the whole family!
text: Played this game last night with my son and his wife (both age 32) along with my grandson (age 11) and what fun we had! I had never played the original version, but my son had and he thought this version was much more fun. You are able to fill in your own answers, which easily could get a little off color, if it was just left up to the adults. Again, they seem to list an age range of 12-15 on the product page, but I would say ages 10 and up, due to the fact that the adults in this household has as much, if not more, fun as my grandson!

title: Great game for all ages!
text: I can't talk to any ages other than this, but I will say that I played this game along with my son (age 31), daughter in law (age 29) and 4 year old (soon to be 5) grand daughter. We had an absolute blast with loads of laughs while playing this (from the youngest to the oldest). Yes, there are a lot of pieces (so you need to keep tabs on them so they don't get lost) and I agree with one of the other reviewers who stated that the shark itself will probably not last for years by any means (takes a lot of abuse). But overall, I have to recommend this game to all. I also like that as my grand daughter gets a year or so older, we can modify the play to help accommodate her skills/capability. This would make a wonderful gift under the tree this year for the youngster in your life. And the box, with the exposed shark, is really cool and will gain the attention of any youngster for sure.

title: Fun for the whole family!
text: Great fun for children of all ages! I bought this for my grandchildren, but I found myself yelling at my 30 year old boys to put it down and let the little ones play with it, lol. Lots of water, great stream of water, this flash flood blaster really fits the bill as a great blaster/soaker for sure! I love Nerf products. I live in Florida now and with the hot weather down here, these (I just purchased another Nerf super soaker as well) will be used at every pool party I guarantee!

title: Fun for the whole family!!!
text: Great fun for children of all ages! I bought this for my grandchildren, but I found myself yelling at my 30 year old boys to put it down and let the little ones play with it, lol. Lots of water, great stream of water, nice size. I love Nerf products. I live in Florida now and with the hot weather down here, these (I just purchased another Nerf super soaker as well) will be used at every pool party I guarantee!

title: Playing with horses has never been so much fun!!!!
text: I gave this to my granddaughter to play with when she visited last weekend. I knew that she loved the My Little Pony dolls, but she didn't have one of the Glamour Glow series, so I knew she was in for a big treat. First, this is a nice size for her 5 year old hands and she had so much fun combing and styling it's hair/mane/tale. Hours of fun, and she squealed with delight when I turned on the horsie and the lights started. Great present for the girl in your life. She also loves horses in general, so this has now been her favorite new toy. Despite what the little video states on this page ('batteries not included'), they are. So, it's fun right out of the box. Kudos to Hasbro!

title: Imagination in action!
text: Rating this a four stars as it is costly and probably an appliance box would work better. However, I like the fact that it has windows and such already cut out and that you can color it. My grandson (4) loved it when I set it up with my son and spent hours (before coloring) playing the 'king'. Again, it is attractive looking, but is lightweight and will not probably hold up with multiple kids inside. But for one child playing alone (or with their parents), it's great. Good imaginative playing for hours and the coloring and personalizing make it worth the cost.

title: Another classic Fisher Price learning toy!
text: My grandson absolutely loved this. He spent hours the first time he played with it, and he actually fought us when we asked him to stop for dinner. I love these Little People Fisher Price toys, and my grandson has another one (airplanes). They are not only educational (good for the parents to discuss the farm animals, the doors, the grass, upstairs/downstairs, etc.), but so much fun for little hands to maneuver the 'people' and animals around the barn/farm. Safe, colorful, hours of fun. This would make a great Christmas present for the toddler in your life.

title: Great, hours of fun, learning experience for toddlers!
text: To begin with, I absolutely love Fisher-Price toys. When my own sons were toddlers I had a closet filled with toys that were not only fun but educational. Now that I have grandchildren, I also try to keep the value of toys in mind when giving them to children. This Laugh and Learn Piggy Bank does not disappoint. My 14 month old grandson spent hours on the first day playing with this. He loves the music, the interaction and the colorful pieces. He is still at the stage of putting things in his mouth but these 'coins' are totally safe and cannot be swallowed. I love that he is just starting to speak and I can see trying to say the word 'uno' on the second stage of this. This bank is a smart toy and teaches children coordination, colors and sounds. Makes a great, relatively inexpensive toy, for the baby or grandbaby in your house. Would make a great holiday present.

title: Another great Radio Flyer product!
text: I got this last week, put it together in minutes (and, trust me, I hate to have to assemble things). My 4 year old granddaughter has not stopped using it. It is better, in my opinion, than a bicycle for first time kids on wheels. Low to the ground, great wheel stability and easy for kids to maneuver. If there was any downside at all (and I don't think it's a big deal) is that it can be a bit noisy. Let's put it this way, with my Sophie going down the sidewalk, no one will not notice or hear her coming. I guess that's a good thing. Bicycles have rubber tires, this has plastic wheels and on cement or even hardwood floors, it can be a little annoying. But you must trust me, the noise is a small trade off for the hours of fun your kids (and grandkids) can have, Would make a great under the tree present this year at a reasonable price for the first time wheeler adventure!

title: Great for the developing musical protegy in your home!
text: I love this Melissa & Doug Upright Piano. Beautiful colors, quality made, bigger than I expected and an amazing sound from what is considered a children's toy. My grandson who is three absolutely adores this (he even likes when I make a melody out of playing Chopsticks, lol). I can see where in another year he will be able to play little tunes on it. For now, he loves experimenting with the sounds, going from low to high and back again. I come from a musical family and I have always prided myself on introducing my own children (and now my grandchildren) to the wonderful world of music. This Melissa & Doug Upright Piano is the perfect way to start a toddler learning to love music at an early age. This would make a wonderful Christmas gift under the tree this year for the future virtuoso in your family!

title: Another great Leap Frog product!
text: I need to start out by saying, I love the Leap Frog product line. With a very active almost 2 year old grandson, I buy many of these to help him learn, but also have fun. This little dog is well made and is fun for him to pull around. The learning of the alphabet is just icing on the cake. I can't say enough about Leap Frog. This toy is less than $20 and should be on everyone's wish list for the holidays for the little ones (I don't know if I would go as high as three year olds, but definitely the 1-2 year old set would love to see this under the tree this year. Educational and fun for hours of entertainment. Can't go wrong.

title: Such cuties!
text: I absolutely love these little dolls. To be honest, I gave them to my niece to play with and she wouldn't put them down. After watching her navigate to the website (absolutely incredible for a 4 year old to be this computer literate), I was sold on this doll. I really would love to own these myself, lol. You can't go wrong with this as a stocking stuffer, add on gift, or a quick little reward for good grades or work. I love them and they will provide hours of fun for your child.

title: Great puzzle!
text: Let me start by saying I love jigsaw puzzles and I love Italy, so this puzzle fits the bill for something to do in my free time. I have never been to Portofino, but after having worked on this for upwards of a month, the harbor is definitely now on my bucket list. The colors are vibrant, the pieces are sturdy and the finished picture is breathtaking and definitely framable (if you are into doing that with your puzzles). It is challenging, yet fairly easy to do. Would think this is more for an adult with a passion for travel and the old country (more so than for a young child). I would highly reccommend this to anyone who loves jigsaw puzzles. Ravensburger makes the best (in my opinion).

title: Absolutely great, challenging, educational puzzle
text: Both my uncle and my father were in the construction industry in NYC/Brooklyn in the 1930's-40's. When I saw this, I remembered the stories I used to hear about how they would dangle from beams on the skyscraper construction. This puzzle is unique that it is in black and white (which is a new, unique challenge for me) and at the same time educational/inspirational for people of all ages. To see how our ancestors had to build the skyscrapers that we all take for granted today, before all the safety precautions of today, is eye-opening. I love puzzles and try to complete one every month or two. I am hooked on black and white now as it brings a whole new dimension to trying to match and fit pieces. I highly recommend this for everyone.

Out of the 2 bags I only got 10 working rings. That is 10 out of 72. One of the 10 rings malfunctioned and a small child brought it back and asked for another one. By this time I did not have anymore. I gave him another bag of skittles. This was a very disappointing purchase for me and the children. I only had 24 total working necklaces and watches. Although the children who received those were happy, I would not recommend this item because you will be losing money and have a lot of sad faced children.

text: I purchased these for my grandsons who are 7 and 10 - much older than the listed age - but both like to 'doodle'. I purchased a blue one and a green one - the stickers were different one had stickers with a dinosaur theme, the other was a wild animal theme.  (I actually went back and order a pink one for myself after experiencing theirs and the stickers were sealife).  As you use the stylus- you will see a multicolored line.  You can use your fingernail - but the stylus works the best.  Honestly, it's hours and hours of peaceful, relaxing, EASY fun.  The screen is about 8x10" ish.  Basically all plastic. title: beaded snowflake craft
text: Eh. Was a lot more work than you would think and NOT much fun.  I did end up making them, but one of the wire forms broke - so only ended up with 5. Definitely set up with towel under your work area because you WILL drop the beads and forms as you're working on them and after about 20 times picking up everything up off the floor, you'll want to figure out a way to keep the beads on a non-floor surface.  They do come with envelopes and seals if you intend to gift them.  Oh, and they include a tiny tube of glue to put on the rubber tips - you will NEED to do this on ALL the tips if you want them to stay on.  Another think I noticed is that if I would have 6 finished, I would have been short 4 rubber tips - which would have rendered the last snowflake - garbage.  If you can't tip the ends, the beads don't stay on. So, the rubber tips are SUPER important.  There were plenty of beads to stretch your artistic wings.  But count your rubber tips first so you will know how many you can actually make.  Eh.  I would not recommend this kit based on the missing pieces and the broken wire of one snowflake.  I did not rate on my dislike of the task.

text: I purchase a new set every year for the summer.  I look for the sets that come in the plastic tubs because that keeps them tidy and easy to manage in and out.  The colors are bright and happy.

title: Cute duck puzzle
text: Mom (80 years) loves puzzles and I thought she'd like this one.  It's cute - 500 pieces so it's fairly easy.  Just wish I would have noticed the seller was Hobby Lobby before I ordered.  Eh.

title: Mesa Verde National Park Puzzle 500 piece
text: Dowdle is one of my Mom's favorite brands.  She loves puzzles and the 500 piece puzzles are easy to do in a short period of time so she really likes them.  The photos and art of this brand are beautifully printed and the pieces are well cut.

title: rectractable crayons
text: I wanted something easy to use with my adult color books.  These are perfect.  The size of a skinny pencil - so it's not like holding a crayon.  I like them.  Wish they came in the 64 color option - but 24 is ok.

title: reversible mochi shape
text: My grandson is busy collecting all of these reversible type stuffed toys... and he likes this because it is very easy to reverse.  Some of the others with legs and tails and ears are bit more challenging.  So this "mochi" shape is the easiest.

title: reversible patchwork kitty
text: My 6 year old grandson is REALLY into these reversible stuffed toys... he loves them all... animals... shapes... they are all "his favorite."  He is a collector of the fun.  This one he named patches...

title: magnetic tic tac toe
text: This is a great game that could go in the car with you because the pieces stick to the tin that the pieces come in.  The box is about 8"x8" ( just eyeballing it).  It includes a second game we haven't played yet with little dots on the opposite side o the inner box - but cool there are 2 games!  My 6 and 9 year old like to play with it - they are rather competitive.  A good value.

title: keekee the monkey game
text: I am always looking for fairly easy games to play with my grandsons... they are 6 and 9.  Honestly, we played this game twice and they were bored.  You take turns placing the wooden cylinders on the keekee - who is standing on a curved banana.  The person who topples keekee is the looser.  It might be better with a 3 or 4 year old?  The cylinders are painted wood - or that's what it looks and feels like.  The rocking body is possibly plastic?  In all honesty, it was just too easy a game for my 6 and 9 year old - but it is sturdily made and would last a long time I think.

title: reversible siamese cat
text: I purchased a different style for my 6 year old grandson's bday (octopus) but I loved the Siamese cat... My six year just loves these - with the switchable happy/mad or sad faces... He says he will never use the sad face because he is always happy.... love love.  Anyway.. the are soft and squishy - I will say that the styles with the longer ears, like the rabbits are a bit less than great because the ears get crinkly... but it's still ok.  I never hesitate to update my review should new info seem useful.

title: reversible stuffed bunnies
text: I purchased 2... one light blue one green.  I had purchased a different style (octopus) for my 6 year old grandson's bday.  He received a pile of gifts - some very extravagant, however the little reversible octo was his favorite of all - just goes to show you, it's not the amount of money you spend.  His 8 year old brother then wanted one.  So, I ordered these for the Easter baskets from gramma.  The only thing I will say is that the bunnies came with the "mad" face out - ears were talk and perked - when you versed to the happy face, the ears are crumpled and floppy.  Wish they would have put the happy face out ward.  I have reversed them and hope the ears will straighten and perk up a bit. The colors are bright - the fur is super soft.  It does take a bit of stuffing to get them reversed but still really cute.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: large hatchimals
text: In all honesty, I purchased 4 of these at christmas.  3 were the exact same, only 1 was different.  Disappointing.  Plus the "hatching" was a real pain.  And 1 didn't really work at all.  I guess I expecting too much.  All four kids were initially excited by these, but very, very quickly grew tired of the "hatching" and the lack luster after opening.  Eh.  They are, in my opinion the "new" furbees.  Fun for a second, and then... Eh.  Just my personal opinion.

title: reversible octo
text: Purchased for my 6 year old grandson's bday... he LOVES "babies" so I always try to choose him something fun.  I think he is going to love that you can reverse this one from smiley face to sad/mad face.  Its about the size of baseball with legs... and it's soft... very easy to turn inside out (for the reverse) and the colors are vivid.  I haven't noticed any shedding.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: twist crayons
text: I purchased two sets for my grandsons (8 and 5) to use on a 6 hour road trip... I liked them because they had caps, and twist to extend.  Seemed like a good choice for the car.  The boys loved them.  And so many colors - more than just the usual 5 or 6.  Comes in a cylinder shaped holder with lid.

title: christmas bell necklace
text: Purchased these for christmas gift projects with my 5 and 8 year old grandsons.  They were easily able to produce them and liked the process.  I wish the beads were a bit nicer - they are just plastic... but over all it was fun.  We did have a couple of bags that didn't have the right end pieces but we robbed other sets since we weren't going to make them all. They gave a bag with spare bead pieces but no spare end pieces - thus I had to take one star away for that.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: invisible ink books
text: The idea of these is great - no mess - easy to use... however, my grandsons, 5 and 8, were quickly bored with the invisible ink process...  Eh.  So you only need one or two of these.  The other items were STICKERS... Eh.

title: christmas pins
text: I am always looking for a new, fun christmas project to do with my grandsons - 5 and 8 this year.  These pins were a bit of a disappointment... you must unbend the pin all the way to thread the beads on... and then rebend - it is awkward to pin on and looks a bit cheap.  To be honest, I ended throwing them away.

title: Navitity pins
text: You have to straighten the pen in order to thread the beads on... and then bend back into shape... and then they don't pin onto your clothes very easily.  Just a disappointed.  Also, about half the of savior pieces were broken in two.  Eh.

title: Yeti Spaghetti
text: My 5 year old grandson just loves to play this game... it's really easy to learn (plastic spaghettis sit in a bowl, the yeti balances on top - take the noodles out, one by one - the person that causes the yeti to fall is the loser - we don't say loser - we all laugh and say "lets go again!).  I like that it is easy to play, easy to store and easy to for small or large groups.

title: card holder
text: I purchased these because my 8 year old grandson couldn't hold all the cards in his hands.  These work great.  They are heavy... they are wood... but they don't tip over..  They don't hold a bunch of cards, but he can use 2 of them and pretty much play anything we want to without struggling to hold them all.

title: Tangled fairy light puzzle
text: I purchased this puzzle for the picture of it... so so pretty!  80 year old Mom is HUGE puzzle fan and this is right up her alley.  750 is a bit more challenging that the usual 500 piece puzzle we usually purchase - but Mom liked the picture too. I purchased about 7 puzzles all at the same time and this was the one she wanted to try first.. so I think that's a win!  Suggestion: We always share the puzzles that mom completes and is ready to unhand with a local adult living community near by!

title: halloween puzzle
text: With the Fall coming, this puzzle seemed like a no brainer!  80 year old Mom is HUGE puzzle fan and this is right up her alley.  500 - 550 pieces make it a short term commitment with an easy success!  Suggestion: We always share the puzzles that mom completes and is ready to unhand with a local adult living community near by!

title: cozy retreat puzzle
text: In anticipation of the Fall and Winter season I thought Mom would like this one... 80 year old Mom is HUGE puzzle fan and this is right up her alley.  500 pieces make it a short term commitment with an easy success!  Suggestion: We always share the puzzles that mom completes and is ready to unhand with a local adult living community near by!

title: greenhouse puzzle
text: Mom picked this out herself after looking at the photo - so much to see.  She was delighted by it.  80 year old Mom is HUGE puzzle fan and this is right up her alley.  500 pieces make it a short term commitment with an easy success!  Suggestion: We always share the puzzles that mom completes and is ready to unhand with a local adult living community near by!

title: mushroom boy puzzle
text: This is really a folksy, quirky looking puzzle.  80 year old Mom is HUGE puzzle fan and this is right up her alley.  500 pieces make it a short term commitment with an easy success!  Suggestion: We always share the puzzles that mom completes and is ready to unhand with a local adult living community near by!

title: lego plane
text: Purchased for my 5 year old grandson who loves planes.  Did help him put it together, but it didn't take long - only 87 pieces.

title: racko
text: I used to play this with my 90 year old grandma - it's an easy game... my 8 year old grandson loves it.  Easy to play - and low tech.  No batteries required.  Game moves fairly quickly.  If you're looking for a good family fun for up to 4 people, this is worth a try!

title: plastic game coins
text: We use these with our Tripoly game instead of poker chips because they are more fun - gold doubloons-  in a way.  They are light, because they are just plastic - but they are well made - we've ordered others in the past that were awkward and oddly different sizes - these are fairly uniform and no sharp edges - so we like them.  I would purchase these again.

title: balsa wood airplane with landing gear
text: These planes are super lightweight (balsa wood) and won't last for long - but while they do, they are FUN.  My 8 year old grandson had a blast.  He wound it up, set in down on our sloped driveway and it actually took off from the ground with the wheels!  These are very delicate and only lasted a couple of days, but my husband enjoyed the nostalgia of playing with them and introducing this 'old style' fun to our grandsons.

title: army guys
text: So... these are not to scale... they are not collector quality.  But they are definitely for play.  My grandsons - 5 and 8 years have enjoyed them.  There are lots of interesting pieces... tanks... army dudes... even some greenery.  For the price they are ok.  I like they come with a zippered storage bag.  A little tricky to get all the pieces back into the bag and zipped, but it is possible.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info should seem useful and I hope this info was helpful to you!

title: magnet blocks
text: My grandsons 5 and 8 play with these for hours and hours.  Seriously.  Hours.  They are probably one of the top 3 toys I have for them to play with.  They are sturdy (but are brittle type plastic - so don't throw them or bang them together really hard).  The colors are bright and primary.  There are so many shapes... AND they come with AWESOME storage tubs.  I would buy these again and again.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful and I hope this info was helpful to you!

title: climbing rope
text: I have a 5 and an 8 year old grandson- they both love to climb... this rope is bit tricky as the bottom is not stable... you have to jump onto it and land with both feet or it will tip you right off.  Once they've mastered the bottom flat piece, the climbing happens... but mostly the swing on the bottom piece.  It seems very sturdy.  I never hesitate to update our reviews should new info seem useful.

title: climbing platform
text: We call this unit the 'Fire Watch' tower as it reminds my 5 and 8 year old grandsons of the fire watch tower at our local forestry center/museum.  They have had literally HOURS of fun climbing on and into it.  There are two open doors on the top tent area that roll up and fix open with velcro (or like) tabs.  It is a forest green and the climbing part of the structure is quite sturdy.  My husband put it together in about an hour and 1/2 and he thinks it will be fairly easy to take apart for storage.  The upper tent material is a sort of thin canvas while the flooring in the tent area is a mesh.  Both boys fit, but I think it would be a tight fit with a third child.  There is an option to make it half the full height as well.  We are very happy with our purchase so far, but I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful and I hope this info was helpful to you!

title: mini car truck hauler
text: purchased 2 of these... two grandsons, 5 and 8 years old.  They love them. Most of their matchbox/hotwheels fit in the slots, of which they have dozens.  It comes with some cars and some safety cones, barrels, etc... they use those misc pieces a lot - playing for hours using their imaginations.  The trucks are mostly black plastic... but roll nicely and the pieces move in and out easily.  The trucks are around 16" long (eyeballing it)... and about 5" tall.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful and I hope my review is helpful to you!

title: pedal go cart
text: Purchased 2 of these for grandsons 5 and 8 years.  Husband put them both together in about 2 hours... they arrive in many pieces.  Metal frame... some plastic cover pieces (wheel hubs, etc)... The wheels are rubber - but thin.  We'll see how long that lasts with the drifter brake and black top.  We chose the bright green and it is.  The seats are adjustable and is working for both boys 3 years apart.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful  - and I hope my review is helpful to you.

title: floating plane
text: Comes in 3 parts... you easily put together... glides a fairly long distance.  No sharp edges.  I purchased for my 5 and 8 year old grandsons - so it's nice there are 2 different colors.  One blue, one red (MIGHT be considered a little dark pink)... They will probably last longer than they have interest in them.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful and I hope this info was helpful to you!

title: magnetic chess board
text: This is my second set of this board ... my grandson is learning (8 years old) and he wanted to take the set home and practice!  It's not super fancy - but works well and is a great size - not too big - and folds in half.  It's really functional and useful.  Thus, the second set.

title: nat geo geodes
text: I have an 8 year old grandson who is going to LOVE these.  Included are 10 Geodes in varying sizes - some really small.. some larger.  They include safety glasses (good idea) and a small plastic magnifying glass for closer examination.  I just opened the box - not the geodes (grandsons arrive in about a month), but they look good on the rough. You will need a hammer and a chisel to open them.  It's going to be like a treasure hunt!  They even include a couple of plastic stands that you set a really spectacular (or just your favorite) geode once it's opened.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: bath toy cups
text: What makes this a great bath toy?  They are easily drainable and cleanable!  I hate those squeezy toys that hold water and then mold.  Yuck.  These work great for both my 5 and 8 year old grandsons.  Each cup is a different size, stacking inside each other for less space storage and like I said, they are cleanable.  Honestly, they may not be the most WOW bath toys, but to me - CLEAN is better.  Having said that, I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: plush toy filled easter eggs
text: Eh.  I ordered these and I guess they are "ok" for the price.. but I have to admit I was disappointed... they arrived with the eggs all open.  They stuff the toys in eggs that are incredibly cheap and don't fully close for two reasons, 1 - the eggs are too small - 2nd - they are SUPER cheap/low quality.  The toys themselves are like ornaments - they have hanging loops.. they are very cheap quality.  Again, for the price you can't expect much - right?  I would not purchase these again due to quality.

title: Lego 295 pc set
text: My 8 year old grandson LOVES these kits.  And this one was particularly "cool" because it had a helicopter.  He was able to complete it in about an hour.  And he is very meticulous, takes his time to read the directions and organizes all the pieces.  It's amazing to watch and see him play with them afterwards.  However, I think we will need to add another room onto the house to store all the completed sets.  That is the one down side... haha

title: dice
text: Purchased these for our bunco kit.  They are bright and easy to read.  Work as they should!  And plenty of them.

title: large deck of cards
text: The only issue I have with these is that they are very difficult to shuffle... but they are fun to play games with.  It's just tricky to shuffle.

title: lego flat squares
text: My grandsons, 5 and 8, spend HOURS playing with their lego collection and these make great bases for the creations.  Just as advertised.  Arrived quickly with other items I ordered (I have prime).

title: lego star wars millennium falcon
text: I purchased 2 of these as I have a 7 year old who is just a lego builder extradinaire - and he has a little brother who is not quite as good at it yet - but always wants what big brother has - so good big brother builds two.  One for himself and one for little brother.  He doesn't seem to mind because he just loves the build.  The oldest loves the Star Wars story - it's all new to him.  So this kit was great.

title: Lego jungle
text: I purchased 2 of these as I have a 7 year old who is just a lego builder extradinaire - and he has a little brother who is not quite as good at it yet - but always wants what big brother has - so good big brother builds two.  One for himself and one for little brother.  He doesn't seem to mind because he just loves the build.  They both love  helicopters and planes, so this kit was popular.

title: Lego last Jedi
text: I purchased 2 of these as I have a 7 year old who is just a lego builder extradinaire - and he has a little brother who is not quite as good at it yet - but always wants what big brother has - so good big brother builds two.  One for himself and one for little brother.  He doesn't seem to mind because he just loves the build.  Star wars is popular theme as they are just discovering the story.

title: snake puzzle
text: Got this for my son-in-laws christmas stocking (he loves these types of puzzles) and it was quickly passed around and around.  It's surprisingly complex... and fun to play with.  It's sort of a fidget thing.  By the end of the day, I believe everyone from age 5 to age 65 had picked it up at least once to mess with it.  I think it was win and perfect for a stocking. It is blue and white, just as shown in the photos and plastic in material.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.  And I hope this info was helpful to you.

title: train table
text: Purchased for 5 year old that saw the picture in a catalog and fell in LOVE with it.  It was very easy to put together, according to my daughter and son-in-law.  They report that it can collapse easily and be moved - a bonus.  He has been busy playing with it ever since he opened it - along with 8 year old brother.  So, I think it appeals to a good age range.  I will update if new info would be useful.  Hope this info was helpful to you!

title: flannel sleeping bag
text: In my opinion these sleeping bags are adult size... and for inside only use... they are flannel lined, so they are comfy - and the cotton material on the outside is fairly sturdy.  The zippers work well (I purchased 2 - different colors).  I also washed and dried them in my washer and dryer...  Took a while to dry, but they did.  The inside, because it is flannel, will pill - and after the washing it has already begun... but my 5 and 8 year olds don't really mind.  They are plenty warm and toasty for inside use - fluffy and soft.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.  Hope my review was helpful to you in some way.

title: magnet building blocks
text: I have two grandsons, 5 and 8 years.  They LOVE these.  The youngest plays for hours and hours... the first day he made over 60 different building and articles.  So impressive.  Lot of laughing and building and designing... so worth the money.  I purchased more pieces and they just keep playing and playing.  What more can you ask for in a toy?  No batteries... Nothing to plug in... just really awesome magnets in heavy plastic pieces.  You'll need at least the 100 piece set... I've purchased 2 of those and a couple of supplemental 60 piece set and the 4 piece train part as I was confident of their popularity in the toy bin.  Now... if they don't stand up to the constant playing... I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful. I hope this info was helpful to you.

title: Happy birthday cuddle barn
text:
Really really cute and we bring to all family birthday celebrations. Always fun. Sound is surprisingly good. I own a dozen or more cuddle barns .. they are always well received and never seem to bring a smile and/or laughs. Which we need more of in this world today. They come with batteries, ready to use. Try one. You'll be back for more. I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.
PS... if a video is not provided... YouTube provides them so it's easy to see and appreciate before you buy.

title: William Tell Cuddle Barn horse
text: My sister has a daycare and this horse is the favorite of the house.  It never fails bring out loud laughter - so that right there makes it a prize.  Most of the Cuddle Barn toys are really good.  They come with batteries and are ready to go.  Once in awhile you get one that is a dud.. but in the about 20 I have so far, only 1 was a return.  This little horse runs and plays William Tell Overture quickly.  It's just the cutest.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: cuddle barn night before xmas
text: Super, super cute.  I am going to have it out during the holidays when my grandsons (4 and 7) visit.  I own many cuddle barn animals. 99% of the time they are awesome.  Have had a couple of clunkers.. but it's rare.  The voice of the bear is very young child voice and is the perfect volume. You cannot adjust the volume. There IS an on/off switch and cuddle barns come already loaded with batteries.  You can you tube to see a video.  The bear is a medium gray... he has a little red jacket with a hood (that does NOT pull up to his head) with white fur trim.  The book he is holding is a felt like material.  He sits and moves slightly side to side and his mouth moves as he reads the whole poem. He is about 10-12" inches tall (eye balling it).  Very very sweet.  I never hesitate to update my review should new info seem useful.

title: cuddle barn frog
text: What a shame. ... as with other reviewers.. my frog came WITHOUT his umbrella.  As much as I would LOVE to have this cuddlebarn... they have to do better in quality control and shipping.  SUPER disappointed.  Immediately returned it.

title: Cuddle Barn Sax Christmas
text: I have a collection of Cuddle Barn toys - they are delightful.  I think their quality and sound is exceptional compared to others.  This one is no exception!  SO cute.. his cheeks inflate and deflate - they also light up as he plays "have yourself a merry little christmas"  - one of my personal favorite christmas songs. He sways a bit as well.  A blusey instrumental version of the song. Perfect to character. The sound is bright and full - just the right volume.  The measurements given are accurate.  He sits about 12".  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: frog bubble machine
text:
Where to start.... the only "good" thing... it makes lots of bubbles. Awesome right?? Until you realize that you must literally STAND right next to it to keep it "fed" with bubble soap. OMG. It will run for about 1 minute before you must refill it. I am SOOO disappointed. It might be more expensive to buy a "pro" bubble machine... but unless you want to post someone to stand there and keep refilling it... *EH* It went right into the dumpster. Partly because in an attempt to "enlarge" the soap capacity, my husband destroyed it. All in frustration. In any case... if you want more than 1 minute of bubbles, go for the more expensive, larger capacity machines. If you are into the bubbles 1 minute at a time... this the machine for you. I never look forward to posting negative reviews.. but sometimes to be honest, it must be done.
UPDATE: 12/5/2018 ... I wish I could rate this ZERO stars... The seller keeps offering me a full refund AND a toy "worth $39.99" to change my review from 1 star to 5. STAY AWAY FROM THIS TOY!

title: Singing Chihuahua
text: I purchased 5 different of these singing toys... and I LOVE LOVE LOVE them all. Oh boy. This guy is ADORBS!  You can move his arms out a bit and his maracas really work! He shakes his arms and his mouth moves.  The sound is terrific.  He comes loaded with batteries with on/off toggle.  If you press his foot he starts, press again he stops... press again and he starts from the beginning. Measurements given are accurate.  He's SUPER soft.  He always produces a smile, so if you're needing a few smiles, you won't be disappointed! I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: furry chimp
text: I purchased 5 different of these singing toys... and I LOVE LOVE LOVE them all. I have to admit this one is probably my fav... sounds like a really excited, happy chimp... bounces around and twirls a bit.  He is SUPER SUPER soft and really cute. He came loaded with batteries and an on/off toggle. A lot of fun and he NEVER fails to make a smile! I am thinking he could be really fun for an older person too... If you press his foot he starts, if you press again he stops.  Honestly, he's pretty dang perfect.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: Singing chicken
text: I purchased 5 different of these singing toys... and I LOVE LOVE LOVE them all. The chicken is definitely one of my personal favs... when he sings (frank sinatra) his mouth moves and his neck goes up and down.  Press his foot and he starts - press again and he stops - when you press his foot again he starts from the beginning... he came preloaded with batteries and has an on/off toggle. Measurements given are accurate.  He is also SUPER soft.  Just a really big hit.  I can't believe how good the sound is too. If you're looking for a big smile, this is sure to please.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: birthday table spray
text: Not quite as full as I would have liked... but I made it work

title: police car pop up tent
text: These are pretty lightweight... they are NOT going to last forever... but will for a season.  They do have bottoms.  There are two large holes in the top for the kids to pop up out of... They pop up quickly and easily - the put away is easy too - but no bag or strap is included - that was a disappointment.  My 7 year old grandson is a bit too big for them, but the 4 year old loved them.  I purchased the police car and fire truck.  The opening has a velcro type closing and a tie for rolling up in an open position.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: pop up fire truck
text: Super flimsy.  But living room sized.  Purchased for over nights at grammas.  They fold up easily and twist to a circle. Disappointing that they didn't come with a storage bag or at the very least an elastic strap for storage.  These will not last forever, but I think probably will last as long as I need them to.  There are 2 large holes in the top and entry in the back with a "roll up" velcro like closure.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: play roller coaster
text: My 4 year old grandson rides this over and over and over.  You'd think this wouldn't be such a draw... but it wins when he is bored with the bounce house or the swing.  I am guessing he'll be too big next year but I have sister that runs a small day care - so I plan to donate it to her.  Win/Win.  It went together quickly and easily.  Took my husband about 10 minutes.  The sections sort of pop in together and stay together even when moved. The "drop" track runs about 6 ft... we have sand so the car slows quickly at the bottom. The track can be taken apart for storage.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.

title: swinging monkey swing
text: Purchased for my 4 and 7 year old grandsons... and my husband installed on a tree limb. The boys like it.  You can lay down on your belly and sway or sit cross legged on it and have someone push you. The circle edges are "padded" sort of with dense foam ring - similar to a pipe insulator. The rope used for the drop seems sturdy. I wanted something a bit different than the usual and this swing fit the bill.  I will update my review should new info seem useful.

title: Upgraded bounce house
text: I have 4 and 7 year old grandsons... they love this.  They usually bounce about 20 mins or so and then move onto something else.. but they come back to the bounce house over and over again.  They are relatively small as boys go... I can see how the 7 year old will be enjoying this for another year or so...and then may be too tall for it... The material seems heavier than the other one I had purchased (My sister borrowed it and didn't give it back haha - but she has a small daycare).  It is easiest for 2 people to set up.  But could be done with one.  It's just easier to have 2 to center on the protective tarp (NOT provided - we owned the canvas tarp).  The colors are bright and beautiful.  One section has a cover over the top which is nice.  I kind of wish the main section was covered too to keep the leaves and such out of it.. but you have to buy a MUCH more expensive "professional" bounce house for that.  In any case, I never hesitate to update my review should new info seem useful.

title: Tripoly deluxe mat version
text: this one of our family's favorite games... and it's hard to find anymore... We've had so many versions over the years.. Our favorite  is old style lazy susan but honestly those are close to million bucks if you can find one!  It's not THAT cool!  This one is just a felt mat.. but what the heck.  The price was the best.  The game itself it so fun... because it moves fast - so everyone stays engaged - It's best to play with at least 3 people - it's perfect with 4 or 5 - just my opinion.  We have played with various "chips"... plastic gold dubloons... even dried kidney beans!  Currently we use 4 different colors of poker chips - each person has there own color and tray- makes it easier to separate at the end of the game.  If you love a game you can visit and laugh and one that moves quickly - this is the game for you to try!

title: 300 piece nerf darts
text: If you own ANY nerf guns... you're gonna need these.  My grandsons are reasonably good with their "darts" but lets be honest... a few stray and are not recovered.  They have the flex 2 guns ( a medium size nerf gun) and they fit perfectly. title: Very sweet
text:
I actually purchased this cat and a nearly identical "FurReal" brand cat... The Joy brand cat was CLEARLY the better purchase. The movements of this cat were more smooth, the meow (was still fakey) was sweeter, you can "feel" the purring.. it seemed to be more interactive. It actually went to "sleep" after putting it down, while sitting pretty. The other brand never quit moving - can you say a BILLION batteries?? Both came loaded and ready with batteries... this brand's box was a MILLION times easier to get into. My Mom loves the color of the gray kitty and named her "Pearl." Perfect. I will say that this brand's fur was just a bit better too. Less shedding and softer. They have a long way to go to make it be a pet "replacement" option... but it's ok as a toy. Mom is keeping hers (this brand) - mine (the FurReal brand) is getting donated. :(
I always update my reviews should new info be useful.

title: A FOR REAL bummer
text:
To be honest, I purchased two of these types of cats... One is this one.. the "FurReal" brand and the other was a "Joy" brand... the cats looked nearly identical, however, the other brand - $25.00 cheaper was significantly better. This one sounds horribly mechanical, jerky - almost looks like the cat is having a seizure. One eye is bright and shiny, the other is dull and scratched.... In order to get the cat out of the box I had to literally destroy the box, otherwise, it would totally be going back - in a second. I'm disappointed to say the least. Even the fur was nicer on the Joy brand! The FurReal brand also did not "go to sleep" either... it was constantly moving - (I see a LOT of batteries being used). The meow sound is very odd and fake. Honestly, if you really think you need to purchase a robo pet - try the Joy brand. It was more real and smooth in movement... the meow, still fake, was sweeter... you could actually feel the purr... and it seemed to be more interactive. It's not perfect either, but a better buy and more satisfying experience.
I always update my reviews if new info would be useful -however, not being able to return this was an expensive donation item - so unlikely there will be much more to report. :(

title: Very sturdy and worth it
text:
purchased for my grandsons to use when visiting..... it is large.... large enough for an an adult to get into. The material is a cotton canvas... not terribly thick, but not too thin in my opinion. It was relatively easy to put together... I like that this is a bottom floor attached. It is quite popular to stay grandma's and camp out.... I added some "nap pads" which are perfect for the 5 and 2 year old. I also added a stuffed bear and alligator and a camp lantern that is a lantern or a star map night light. Honestly, I keep it up in the corner of my living room so it is ready for any visit. It does come with a handy bag that has a handle if you'd like to store it when not in use. The poles are wood... a pine I believe... very sturdy. I would recommend this teepee... I always update if there are any issues that may be helpful.
3/25/2016 UPDATE: ...so I just finished deconstructing the teepee and felt an undate with tips might be helpful... first... you will never get the canvas teepee back into the canvas bag provided... it's like folding/rolling a really thick fitted sheet and trying to get into a tube sock.... BUT the wooden poles fit nicely into the canvas bag along with the plastic connector pieces... it would have been nice if the connectors gripped the poles better and stayed connected during the deconstruct phase... however... I just removed all the holed top pieces and then turned the teepee upside down and shook it sort of like a pillow case... the lower pieces eventually come out... I just rolled the teepee up, put all the poles and connector pieces in the bag and set in a large drawer I have. I would have lowered my rating one star for the deconstruct hassle, but honestly, my grandsons love it so much I just can't. The quality is such that this is going to last for many years if we take care of it. It's just a matter of learning how to use it in an efficient manner. Also... I have hard wood floors, so I went to a local carpet store and purchased some carpet padding. I cut into a circle and place it under the teepee when I have it set up... I worry less about bonked heads that way - grandsons 5 years and 2 years. Ok! Hope this is indeed helpful info!

title: HOORAY!!
text:
Ok... this is NOT exactly the skip it of my youth... but after purchasing many disappointing knock-offs that broke immediately or didn't work because of basic design falls....and "modern" versions that also don't work (twister skip it- the dingle is WAY too heavy and the "cord" is twisted and doesn't want to fly around your ankle), avoiding still others due to horrible reviews and looking on ebay and finding one that was CLOSE for $120!!! .... I found this one... No reviews... I admit, I was scared... plus I worried about the knobby bouncy ball... but EUREKA!! It works!! Listen it lights up and eventually it will die as the batteries are not replaceable... but WHO CARES? You can STILL skip it! I am LOVING this. Wish I was still as young and bouncy as I used to be 40 years ago... but I adored it then and now. I just can't do it for hours like I used to...and I'm a bit slower. :) I'm pretty sure this counts as exercise and it's fun! Of course, mine is covered in sand cause I skip on the wide open beach. If you were a fan of the original, you'll find this amusing and it works! I'm getting two more... one for my sister (else she WILL steal mine) and one for the house that isn't covered with sand. :) You do need a pretty good size area that is clear... but it works on floors or carpets and sand of course. I'm pretty sure people think it's very amusing to see an old, fat lady skipping down the beach. HA!
The loop is plenty big enough to slip over your shoe... 5 1/2" diameter on the side of the plastic ankle loop... the cord is tube covered (this is REALLY important because otherwise the cord just wraps around your ankle and you can't "skip it").... the ball is attached to cord very well... I yanked on it... stood and pulled... obviously more than you need to do... but I wanted to test it.
You don't get to pick your color... doesn't bother me. I got a really great purple one in my first order.
I will update if there are any breakage issues, but honestly it's pretty dang well made and I don't expect those kinds of issues.

title: better than adding to the landfill
text:
They are plastic, and striped only in the front and oposite side... but that is okay for me...
Took a star off for the HORRIBLE tape they had ALL OVER them. AND terrible paper stickers on the bottom of each one. Took me 3 hours with a LOT of orange de-sticker stuff to remove. WHAT a nightmare... WHY on earth would you tape all sides with the worst tape ever??
They are very, very lightweight... and flexible. I would NOT put them in the dishwasher.
Took another star off because they are SO cheap and NOT 100% recycled, I knew that before purchasing... but I can still wish.
Others have reported Dollar store pricing.. I don't have a dollar store, and paid about $2 each for the set of 4 including shipping. They certainly are not worth more than that.
So, that leaves us with 3 stars. The up side is that you are not adding more garbage to a landfill by washing and reusing these. They are a good method for portion control (otherwise, I'd sit with the giant stainless mixing bowl full on my lap).
I can't say I would recommend them, unless you were considering paper disposables.

title: ASSEMBLY!!
text:
I really didn't realize I was going to have to put so much of this together... sigh... You will need a rubber mallet, a phillips head and flat head screw drivers, 2 adjustable wrenches and an old blanket or padding to rest it on while you build it. On the "up" side, It is real metal and should last a long time, but they really could ship the car MUCH more assembled. It would take a SLIGHTLY larger box is all. FURTHER... I bought it two days ago and I see the price has dropped around $25.00! THAT IS VERY DISAPPOINTING and insult to the injury of having to assemble it. I don't have a handy "guy" around. ARGH!
All in all, I'd go to Sears or other major brand store and buy one already assembled probably for 1/2 the price.

title: Lego is always expensive, but I was hoping the more expensive, the more time consuming
text:
I bought this for my 13 year old as a Christmas gift expecting he would take 2 weeks to finish on top of all the chores I gave him for winter break. Not only did he do all the dishes, the laundry, whine and cry about chores, play on his ipad, fight with his brother, and argue with me, he ended up finishing the millennium falcon in under a week! Lego needs to create more difficult items to build if I'm paying almost $200.

Overall, the item turned out really awesome! He loved it!

title: Requires gentle, yet strength to assemble
text:
I was super excited to receive this item because it claims to light up and turn in multiple ways, however assembly was a pain! Assembly of this product was so painstaking, I ended up having a couple of dented finger nails, some splinters, and a bunch of broken and scratched up skin. This item requires a lot of finger strength, yet it requires gentle assembly. There are certain parts during assembly where it requires me to gently slide in one part, yet push it in with force. the longitudinal wood pieces came in 12 pieces, but to assemble, it must fit into 5 different slots. I broke about 9 little slots in 9 difference pieces. The instructions were all pictures, but certain parts of the instruction must be studied in detail!!! I studied certain steps and was confident; turned out, I was wrong and had to break it apart which caused more broken wooden pieces. The last part, one of the pieces didn't come fully cut, so when I pushed a piece in, it snapped. Overall, if this item I assembled was not examined in detail, nobody would see any of the cracks. I like what I assembled and it did turn out great, but I refuse to ever do this again!

and it wont turn! I waxed the pieces that required waxing, but as hard as I try to turn the knobs, the globe wont turn! If I force, it'll turn a little bit, but I feel like it might break!

title: Decent product with a few broken
text: I bought these a few weeks before Halloween because a group of 100 children from a nearby school claimed they were going to come trick-or-treating at my work place.  Either 90% of the school called in sick or the director played us, but that was a good call because a bunch of these slap bracelets came broken.  A few of these slap bracelets wouldn't snap into a circle when slapped.  A few of them were not properly sealed so I was able to see what was inside of the slap bracelet.  There were a couple that just came with the outer piece/shell without anything inside so it was just a limp piece of plastic.  A bunch of them were badly printed or badly cut so that I was able to see another color irrelevant to the actual one.  Please see all photos as reference.  There was a decent amount to pass out, but if you're planning to pass out to exactly 108 kids,  a good quarter or a third of the kids would be very disappointed.  Luckily, the director lied and most of the kids didn't show up to claim these "trick"-or-"treats".

They played with them for a week and even took them to their other grandmas and their older teen brother played and loved them too.  They then decided that they worked so well, that we should try it from my house to theirs. They left me the 3rd walkie talkie and we can now communicate any time we want. I love it. Great quality for a toy. They helped reconnect us while quarantining.
