title: Fox and Racoon too big or Moose is too Small
text: These seem like good quality and the colors are nice and seem accurate.  I was concerned that the horns of the moose might be sharp and could hurt a child if they fell on the toy, but no worries here; the horns are soft and bendable.  If you tried to bend them much, they might break off though.  The price seems reasonable.  If you buy them to teach your children about these animals, there is one problem.  The racoon and fox are over half the size of the moose, so the proportions are all wrong.  The fox and racoon are about the right size in relation to each other, but next to the moose, the grouping looks strange.  Looks like we an have incredibly large mutant fox and racoon or incredibly small mutant moose.  I noticed there are other groupings available in this brand and I would have paired the moose with maybe a bear and a deer.  Then put the fox and racoon with another animal about their size.  The package contains only one small paragraph about the 3 animals, so this is not an educational toy by any stretch of the imagination.  Smaller, younger kids probably won't care about any educational benefit anyway or the size proportions of the animals, so this may not be a big deal.  As a kid, I would have loved a set like this.  I suppose a smart kid would pick up on the size discrepancy if they have ever been to a zoo and seen some of these animals or seen a TV program that showed the sizes.

title: PERFECT PLACE TO PLAY FOR LITTLE ONES
text: My son's granddaughter loves this little tent and prefers it over another one that she had.  It's cute and easy to set up.  Small enough not to take too much space and big enough for 1 or 2 young kids to play in.  Price is reasonable.

title: Well Constructed, Realistic Looking, Good for Play or Collectors, Kids or Adults
text: I guess I am a kid at heart, as I loved the movie CARS.  I got these with intentions of giving them to some children, but I like them so well, I am going to keep them.  They appear to be quite well constructed, made of a combination of hard plastic, metal and on "Mater" some rubberized material for his mirrors and towing chains.  The vehicles are small, being about 3" long and 1 to 2 inches high.  They are nicely detailed and well painted and are not cheap looking.  They would be fun to play with for kids, especially if they have seen and liked the Cars movie.  These seem rugged enough to handle quite a bit of play.  They also look nice enough for adult collectors.  A fun item for kids or adults

title: Okay Toy; Not Great
text: My great grandson who is about 6 did not care for this toy.  In order to launch Thomas the train engine, you have to physically tip up the track.  The function of the toy is rather limited, as it seems to do just one thing.  The engine runs along a track and a shark tries to grab it; then it does a loop.  That's about it.  The included helicopter is supposed to carry Thomas off to safety after he escapes the shark, but obviously that's something that occurs only in a child's imagination.  The helicopter is just an extra included toy and can stand alone.  It's not a bad toy and the engine is cute and well made.  Probably not something that your child would find that many hours of entertainment from.  There are better toys out there for about the same money.

title: Colorful and awesome dragon; fun set with some challenge
text: The dragon in this set is really awesome looking.  It's quite a clever toy and involves some skill in aiming the car correctly to hit the dragon.  I think kids stay with a toy longer if there is some challenge to it and not just a passive toy.  Very colorful and fun.  With all the moving parts and a lot of plastic, I am not sure how long it would last without breaking.  Unfortunately just about everything is made from plastic these days, so there is not much choice for truly durable toys.  Although probably best suited for a boy, I can't imagine any kid, boy or girl, not liking this.

title: FUN FOR KIDS WHO LIKE DINOSAURS
text: What kid doesn't like dinosaurs?  This is perfert for your boy or girl who is into dinosaurs.  I suppose it could be considered an educational toy, but probably only marginally so.  Who says educational toys can't be fun too?  This is especially nice for a kid interested in archeology.  Contains a block of plaster that has embedded into it "DNA" stickers and a glow in the dark dinosaur.  After the fun of digging out the dinosaur and stickers with the included digging tools and brush, they are left with a dinosaur model, so even though the digging fun is over after one time (if they do it all at once), there is something to show for it.  There are also two "augmented reality" (AR) play mats that are completed with the DNA stickers that have been "excavated".  The mats when used with a cell phone and an application from the App Store (for Apple phones) or the Google Play Store (for Androids) produces a 3D dinosaur, visible on the phone.  One problem with this is that it might not work with all cell phones.  It is supposed to work with MOST Apple devices (8.0 and above).  On Android phones the only devices tested are Google Nexus Series, Samsung Galaxy S5 and Samsung Galaxy Tab.  I didn't have a cell phone to test this on, but it seems like it still might be fun even if that part doesn't work.  It's just that you might not be able to use the full capability of the kit if your phone doesn't work with the application.  Also if you give this to a child of only 8 (the lower age limit on this), they may not yet have a cell and you may not want them to have one at that age.  Since this contains many small parts, it needs to be kept away from small children, as there is a choking hazard (box says no one under 3).  I would have loved a toy like this when I was a kid.  Just remember to put down a newspaper when they are working on the plaster block in order to collect all the plaster pieces that are chipped off as they excavate.  Pricing of the kit is very reasonable.  Made in China.

title: VERY NICE DETAIL; WELL-CONSTRUCTED; MOLDED IN SEVERAL COLORS; GREAT FOR KIDS WHO LIKE HORSES
text: This is a really cute set good sized set (roughly 18 inches long and 4 inches high) made of rugged plastic and with real rubber tires.  The truck looks realistic with nice details inside the cab with a center console, two bucket seats, a dashboard and a steering wheel.  It is molded in 4 colors plus a clear plastic windshield, sunroof and back window.  The side doors have no windows.  The steering wheel turns, but is not functional for turning the wheels.  The two front doors of the truck both open.  The hood of the truck opens to reveal an engine.  Nice detail including non-functioning headlights, parking lights, front grill, side mirrors, gas cap and a rear tailgate that also opens.  The only assembly required on the truck is putting on the 4 tires, which should be easy for just about any kid.  The horse trailer also requires putting on 4 tires and a special wheel in the front; also there are 6 trailer pieces that have to be snapped in place. An illustrated book shows how to install the pieces.  Pretty easy, but a younger child might have a little trouble figuring it out.  The pictures on the side of the trailer and the license plates on the truck and trailer are provided in a sheet of stickers, which a child can place where they like.  Includes a completely black horse with a blanket, 2 figures (a driver for the truck and a handler for the horse) and several accessories for the horse including a bridle, halter, saddle, a couple brushes, a bale of hay and a bunch of carrots.  Suitable for both boys or girls, especially those who like horses.  Probably this toy would be preferred by girls since the truck is pink and the horse handler is female. Even some adult collectors might like this set as it is colorful, detailed and well made. The real downside that I see to this set is that if you have very young children who will be around this, they could easily put one of the small pieces in their mouth and choke.  There is no instructions on showing how to use the horse accessories; most are obvious, but a couple are not.  The most important thing to know is that this is more of an "old school" type of toy; no batteries, no motors, no remotes.  A lot of kids today want the latest electronic devices and radio controlled toys, but this toy allows them to use their imaginations a little. I think that's a plus, but if you buy this for the kid who wants a cell phone instead, there will be a level of disappointment, I'm sure.  Note that this is made by a German company, with components from Germany, China, Romania and Tunisia. It's not that important to me where it is made, but it might be to you.  Note too that you can also buy other items in this series, such as a barn type structure, a corral and other horses.  If your child insists on other components, it could get expensive, if you give in.  As a kid at heart, I like this toy a lot myself and would keep it if I didn't have so many other things.  It will probably go to a grandson.

title: GREAT TOY IF YOUR CHILD IS YOUNG ENOUGH AND LIGHT ENOUGH
text: My great-grandson liked this a lot and really enjoyed riding it.  He's not a large kid, but is one year older than the recommended ages for the toy.  He is within the weight limit, which I think is 50 pounds or under.  He can probably enjoy it for about a year, but he was almost too big for it now so you probably don't want to get this for a child who is approaching the upper age limit, which I think the box said was 5.  Also, if you have a big child close to the maximum age and maximum weight, they might not fit the toy.  At around a $200 price, I consider this to be a luxury toy and you might be able to find toys for a lot less that would be just as much fun for a kid.  I recommend getting it for kids at the lower end of the age range (2 or 3), so they can enjoy it for a few years before they outgrow it.  Of course you can always donate it when they do outgrow it.  Not much to assemble on it and the few parts that need to be put on are easy to install.  The only real downside to this toy is the initial charge time of 18 hours.  Kids are impatient (some adults are too) and if you present this to them and then they find out they can't use it until the next day, there could be some disappointment.  Of course that could be a way to teach patience too.  After the initial overnight charge, the battery seemed to last quite well, so they should be able to enjoy a driving session until they lose interest and a recharge is needed.  This is not huge, but it is a large item that you need a storage place for and a place to plug it in while it is charging.  As several reviewers have said, this works better on hard surfaces.  This doesn't move very fast, but fast enough for younger kids; older kids might find it too slow.  Obviously too, as a kid gets older they might not find a toy like this that "cool".  Since this is a motorized riding toy, obviously you do need to supervise a kid while riding it, especially younger ones; don't buy it if you think you are going to turn your kid loose with it and not have to watch them.  You need adequate space in your house or a big driveway to use this, as you probably don't want the kids driving it in the street, unless you live in a very low traffic residential area and/or are right beside them when they are using it.  Probably best for use on sidewalks or a fenced yard if you are going to use it outside.  Keep in mind too that if you go any great distance away from your house and the charge runs out, you now have a 50 pound toy to somehow get home.  How noisy a toy is also can be a factor on whether you want to get it or not; this runs reasonably quiet, which is a plus.  A fun toy for the appropriately aged small child.

title: Not Really a Toy; This is an Advanced Modeler's Kit
text:
This kit is made of cast metal parts of just a single silvery color, so it has to be painted to look good. It's very small, only about 3" by 2". I had a lot of trouble getting the walls to stay glued and fitting them together properly. The parts have to be washed with soap and water before they will stick, but even that didn't help much I switched super glues and had a little better luck. You need cyanoacrylate glue to glue the metal pieces together.

The picture of the model on the box cover is decorated by a professional modeler or artists, so depending on how skillful you are, your results might not be as good.

I think this is marketed as a toy, but it's not a toy. It's designed for people who want to spend some time building and custom painting a model railroad structure.

Both the advantage and disadvantage of this kit is that you can custom paint it any way you like. That's more work than kits that are cast or molded in multiple colors, but looks more like you built it, than coming from a kit that anyone can buy and build.

For the high price that Woodland Scenics charges for their kits, it would be nice if they would include basic paint colors in the kit or at least include the information on what paints to buy and techniques for painting and weathering. I was able to e-mail the company and they quickly and generously supplied the info, but one shouldn't have to ask. It should be a part of the kit.

It's hard to beat the realistic look of these kits, but it does require some time and skill to build and decorate to get the look you want.

This kit is not really worth the money, since it is so small and requires so much work to get it looking good.

title: Very Cute Doll
text:
This is a very cute doll that any little girl (and perhaps some boys) would adore.
Even adults who are into collecting dolls might be interested, although I would not call this a collector doll by any means. It is a doll that is meant to be played with. The pretend scissors look pretty safe and do move back and forth and make a clicking sound. The water squirt bottle might be okay for some kids, but I know some kids would be using it to squirt someone with, instead of the doll's hair, so use your own judgment on that. At least it only holds a few ounces of water or whatever you put in it. Some kids I know would probably put soda in it and be squirting it into their mouths! The doll does have a really full head of hair, so those children who enjoy it, will probably have fun combing the hair and styling it and using one of 3 barrettes. Educational value for grooming?--maybe a little, but this is not an educational toy. The dress the doll wears is cute, with a pink poodle on it. I really don't think you can go wrong with this doll as a gift for young children who like dolls, even if they don't care that much about the grooming aspect. The eyes are painted on and don't look realistic to me, but at least nothing that can be broken or poked out. The doll's skin is slightly brown and the box has Spanish wording as well as English, so could be appropriate for children of varying skin tones.

title: My boyfriend flushed it!
text:
The package"arrived this evening, I'd snuck into the bathroom and positioned it perfectly in drape of the seat. Unfortunately, boyfriend did not use the bathroom immediately despite my estimations, in fact HOURS went by and suddenly I heard a flushing.

I asked if he flushed it. He looked at me. I now know this man loves me above all things as there was no judgement in his expression, just a solemn nod. Despite my laughter, he was still slightly shell shocked and not sure how to respond. He wasn't sure to believe that it was plastic. "It looked so real," he lamented with regret because now he wishes he could have kept the poo.

So far, no plumbing issues resulted in the flushing. Not sure how we'd explain that to maintenance. Summary: Don't hesitate, gag your family and friends but make sure they don't flush it!!! Best $5 I've spent in a while.

title: Scratches the League of Legends itch in Board Game format
text:
I was looking for a DotA / MOBA in board game format and this fits the bill pretty nicely.

It's quite expensive and also a massively complex game. Not for the faint of heart. If you want super premium components, you get what you pay for. Comes with cases and shelves for all the components, and the art on the neoprene mats and the cards is gorgeous. I'm quite happy with it, but it's one of those "big box" games that you only need one or maybe two of in your entire collection.

As a game it feels a bit different than League of Legends (as it should given the format), but it's just something to be aware of and expect. I had been designing my own DotA board game and it's not exactly what I had in mind, but it's definitely fun.

The biggest drawback is the learning time and the playing time. I wouldn't even consider doing more than 2 players unless everyone in the group had already played several 2 player games and knew the rules well. It could really benefit from simultaneous turns and I'll be thinking up some house rules for sure to make the playthroughs not take quite so long.

The races are pretty asymmetric which some people might not like. You need to learn one race and stick with it. The complexity is far too big to bounce around and try each race in turn. Each race's choice of minions, spires, heroes, and faction upgrades has a LOT of different options and it could be pretty overwhelming at first. Learning all the different abilities, how they work, and figuring out how to work that into your strategy and gameplay.

title: Basically Jurassic Park the game
text:
I already like Tiny Epic games. This is probably my favorite. If you can imagine a Jurassic Park game, this is more or less the one you want. Small package, great price, endless fun. What more can you ask for?

You build parks and enclosures to house dinosaurs. The dinosaurs are hungry. If you can't feed them, they'll still eat - guess what? - your other dinosaurs! Very well made and lots of fun. If you don't like this game, maybe board games aren't your thing.

I look at this game as an example to understand how to make games well. I think anyone who likes board games has to give at least one Tiny Epic game a try, and this is the one I would recommend most.

Limited closet space? Desperate for something besides Monopoly, Risk, or Settlers of Catan? Like building games with dire consequences? Think dinosaurs are the least bit cool or interesting? Look no further.

My only minor criticism is that some might consider it complex with the different special dinosaurs and some of the rules about how and when to place dinos. Any board game is going to have a learning curve, and this one is small.

title: Great quality Goban (Go board)
text:
If you're looking for a wonderful thinking game, this is an excellent purchase to get started. It comes with a Go instruction booklet as well, which hits all the high points of gameplay without being too long or boring. If you read your way through the entire book (about 20 illustrated pages) you will be well on your way to understanding most aspects of the game.

Several tips to note about this board:

It has 9x9 grid on one side and 13x13 on the other, which makes it the perfect board for beginners or those learning Go. These smaller sizes are normally used by less experienced players to learn the basics of the game, without being overwhelmed by the length of a full 19x19 match. A 9x9 game, depending on how long the players take to think about their moves, will take about 10 to 20 minutes, and a 13x13 game takes about 20 to 40 minutes.

The wood is spruce and is very good quality for a beginner's board. I have not used it for very long so I don't know how long it would take the lines on the board to wear off or show signs of use. However, it's still in pristine quality from when I bought it, and I've used it quite thoroughly. Any dust or dirt can be easily wiped off with a dry or slightly damp cloth (it comes with instructions on how to care for the board).

Of primary consideration is the quality of the Go stones that come with this board. If you don't have any stones, this is also a great purchase because the stones are rust-proof and will never crack, break, or corrode. They are nice and big, so they are easy to hold and become used to playing Go with. Another plus is that it comes with enough stones for a 19x19 game, so if you later choose to purchase a full sized board, you'll have enough stones to play with.

Overall, a great purchase if you want to jump into learning how to play Go.

title: Lego for adults is genius marketing and a lot of fun!!
text:
As a child I was a huge fan of Legos and had dozens of sets… Ranging from castles to pirates.
However, they've been sitting in boxes in the basement for the last 30 years… When I happen to discover Lego‘s new botanical collection at the botanical garden, I had to buy for nostalgia value.

The first thing I immediately noticed is the boxes are much harder to open… I actually had to look on YouTube for how to open it without destroying the box. (hint: run a butter knife along the edge to loosen the glue). Once I got it out of the box, it is self-explanatory, with components labeled in four separate bags and an assembly tool.

It took me around two hours to assemble, a lot of the assembly is repetitive as you are making the same parts over and over for the base, stems, and flowers.

The base is highly interesting as it looks very simple from the outside, but it's made of rotating parts inside in different colors.

The flower stems can be arranged at different heights and patterns, making it fun to customize. I loved the realistic snaking roots and Dirt toned blocks to fill in around the stems.

I paid $50 for this from the official Lego store and don't regret it for a second; it looks fantastic on top of my Japanese tea chest and it was a lot of fun. My next challenge is a Lego bonsai!

title: A fantastic family project and must-have for Stars Wars fans!
text:
No stranger to Legos, I've been assembling various themed kits since the early 1980s. I was also a child when the original Stars Wars movies came out, and over the years have owned various Stars Wars merchandise like lunchboxes, toys, action figures, Viewmaster Slides, and other collectibles.

So when I was offered the chance to test drive the LEGO Millennium Falcon, I was overjoyed.

It had been years since I last assembled a Lego set.

The level of detail on this is amazing - it has an opening cockpit, interior access, hidden compartments, spring-loaded external weapons and five figures including C3PO and R2D2.

With nearly 1,400 pieces, this is not a kit for the short of patience or faint of heart, but it DOES make a fantastic project the whole family can enjoy together.

(and if you lose / misplace the directions, you can handily download / print from Lego's official website if you search by kit number 7527).

The perfect gift for any Star Wars fan, whether you're a child or a child at heart!

title: Beautifully-crafted puzzle will provide hours of entertainment
text:
I had the luck of visiting Portofino last October, and was instantly hooked on this 1,000-piece Ravensburger puzzle that perfectly captures the vibrant colors and Mediterranean atmosphere of the town. The framing of the photo is interesting as well, with several moored boats in the foreground and the harbor in the background. The level of detail in the high-resolution photo is amazing (the finished puzzle measures 27 X 20). The puzzle pieces are sturdy (unlike some cheaper puzzles I've assembled) and nonglare.

This is a fabulous challenge to have on hand for weekends or relaxation; the large amount of blue in the water and sky make these more difficult sections to accomplish, but the end result is well worth the effort!

title: A true VIP (Very Irish Princess)
text: Coming from an Irish family, I have accumulated many different types of Irish collectibles over the years: stuffed animals, Beanie Babies, glasses, books, jewelery...all with some sort of Irish theme. But until recently I didn't have any Irish dolls, porcelain or otherwise. I have been collecting Dolls of the World Barbies for a number of years, and more recently Princess of the World dolls, so I couldn't believe it when I found out that a Princess of Ireland Barbie would be made. I was nervous that the doll wouldn't "feel" Irish enough. So when I received her in the mail I was pleasantly surprised that she was even more beautiful than in the photos online. Her complexion is very fair, and her auburn hair is stunning in natural light. Her green eyes are sparkling and mysterious, and she wears a very light rose eyeshadow that makes her beautiful eyes stand out even more. Her costume is sort of a medieval/Celtic blend. She wears a velvety soft forest green cloak with a golden Tara brooch clasp, a traditional Celtic design. Her dress is a crinkly olive green fabric with a stripe of Celtic designs down the middle. At her waist she wears a belt of three golden medallions with Celtic designs, and on her head, perfectly balanced atop her auburn hair, a golden crown fit for an Irish princess. The box she comes in is also perfect for displaying her in. Appropriately enough, it is green (Ireland is actually a Viking word for green) with golden trim. The backdrop inside of the box is an Irish castle. There is information about the Celts on the back of the box. This is sure to become a treasured keepsake in my family, and I'm planning on buying more for relatives and friends.

Fun project to work on. It is smaller than you would think with the size of the box.

title: Very nice.  Creative fun
text: This is creative fun.  The set is well made and all parts are included.

title: Cute toy
text:
toy is durable and adorable. My grandson loves putting it together and taking it apart. He puts it back in the cute box and puts it back together when he comes back to visit.

It's a very nice toy and worth the money.

title: Love legos and this set is very nice.
text: It's not difficult to put together.  It's enough of a challenge to be fun.  The legos go together easily.  They are bright and colorful

title: Ordered a hedgehog, but received a bear with no stuffing
text: I received the wrong item and it wasn't a stuffed toy at all.  I received a flat item that was supposed to be stuffed.

title: This is a fun quick tent
text: Love the fire truck. It's a fun and easy to put up tent to play in.  It's a little bit of a challenge to fold back up, but it's doable.  I love that it's so easy to set up.  You have a fun place for the littles to play in less than a minute.  Stands well, the colors are nice.

title: Fun and colorful
text: This game is fun for littles. It's basically a matching game.  The cards are colorful and the design is fun.  The cards should last for awhile.  They are good quality.

title: Perfect lego toy for beginners!
text:
My children and grandson love legos! My adult children still love the advanced legos. The creative side never goes away!

This tow truck is perfect for my grandson! The pieces go together well and easily, but also stay well.

The truck works fantastic! Love it!

title: This is a good learning tool, but difficult
text:
This dinosaur is difficult to put together. The pieces, especially the foot cover is hard to put on.
It's a nice learning tool, but just not a great toy for playing.

My grandson loves it, but it took a lot of work to put it together.

title: This is so cute, but it's hard to pedal.
text: This little bike was a hit for the little guy, but it's hard to pedal.  I think it's the position of the pedals.  All of the other functions are great and he loves it.

title: He loved it!
text: All the pieces were included and fit together as expected with Legos.  The  pieces are colorful and the instructions are easy to read.

title: CAT toys are decently made.  Not top quality, but better than some brands
text: This is a cute excavator.  Not tonka for sure, but still a decent toy. I think it will last for awhile.  I'm really used to Tonka quality and this just isn't there.

title: Kids had fun putting this together.  Top quality as always
text: the kids love this!  They had a blast putting this set together.  You can't lose with legos. Always top quality and the colors are bright.

title: This is an ok float. I received the round one with the little back
text:
This float is ok. It's fun for the pool. Nothing fancy. It inflates fairly easily and is about medium grade.
The colors are bright and fun. I don't see it lasting more than one summer, but it'll be comfy while it lasts.

title: Not a good value. Doesn't work properly
text: This doesn't stand properly with water movement.  It works better in the grass than in the water.  Not worth the price.
